moves.1. e4: I have only just started playing this opposed to my normal d4, but am really starting to enjoy the positions that arrise.
moves.3... a6: The most played move, making the bishop decide what it will do.
moves.4. Ba4 Nf6: counter-attacking against the sometimes weak e4 pawn
moves.5. O-O b5: Maintaining his ability to go into the Open lines with ...Nxe4
moves.7. c3 O-O: Not the best move, allowing white a strong iniative and the center
moves.11... Ne7: moving yet another knight into a passive position
moves.12. Nc3: Some would try to force things, with something like d5.  But I don't think this is right in this position. I am now fully developed other than my rooks
moves.12... h6: A wasted tempo but what else is he to do?
moves.13. Qd3: The bishop is poison.  See if you can find it. (it's pretty obvious)
moves.13... hxg5: yet he takes it anyways, now the game is over.
moves.14. Nxg5: He can't play Ng6 because I just take it and mate on the move
moves.14... g6 15. Qh3:
Mate can not be avoided.  Here he graciously resigned, as he sees he can't do anything.

Hope you liked this minature.
